title: Introduction to Molecular Biotechnology
description: The aim of this course is to introduce the basic principles and current topics in molecular biotechnology. The course will first cover major discoveries for the advancement of molecular biotechnology, basic principles of gene expression and recombinant DNA technology. Then, selected topics in molecular biotechnology such as human genome project, microbial, plant, animal and medical biotechnology will be introduced.
outcome: - to grasp an overview of the principles and various aspects of molecular biotechnology - to be able to find materials on topics of molecular biotechnology - to enhance the presentation and discussion skills
syllabus: Introduction and overviews of the following topics in biotechnology: 1. Microbial biotechnology 2. Plant biotechnology 3. Animal biotechnology 4. Marine biotechnology 5. Environmental biotechnology 6. Applied immunology 7. Gene therapy 8. Social impacts of biotechnology  Students are required to select a topics in molecular biotechnology, and present a poster.
recommended_readings: Glick & Pasternak “Molecular Biotechnology: Principles and Applications of Recombinant DNA”

title: Diversity of Life: Applications and Sustainability
description: The course is designed to train students to acquire an overall view on the diversity of living organisms, with emphasis on their potential applications and sustainable survival. The concepts of phylogeny and evolution will be used to explain how the living organisms diversify along the time line. Selected examples from major groups of living organisms will be chosen to discuss: (i) how to make proper use of these biological resources in important issues of human society such as health, agriculture, environment, and energy; and (ii) how they adapt and survive in a particular environment and the challenges that affecting their sustainable existence
outcome: The students will: •understand the concepts of phylogeny, evolution, and speciation and are able to apply these concepts to explain the diversity of life; •acquire knowledge on important characteristics distinguishing major groups of living organisms: eubacteria, archebacteria, protists, plants, fungi and animals; •understand the importance of living organisms to human survival and development of biotechnology, and elaborate with some selected examples; •understand the theory of human evolution and the interactions between hosts and viruses; and •appreciate nature and life; and cultivate a responsible attitude toward protection of biodiversity.  學生將會: •明白有關系統發生、演化和物種形成的概念, 並應用這些概念來解釋生物多樣性; •獲得能分辨主要生物種類的重要特性的知識, 包括細菌與古細菌、原生生物、植物、 真菌和動物; •明白各種生物對人類生存及生物科技發展的重要性, 並能以具體例子闡明; •明白人類進化的理論及寄主與病毒的相互作用; 及 •懂得欣賞大自然和生命; 培養一種對保護生物多樣性的負責任態度
syllabus: • Introduction: the Concepts of Phylogeny, Evolution, and Speciation • Eubacteria and Archebacteria: Impacts on Health and Biotechnology • Protists: the Dawn of the Eukarya, an Important Milestone in Evolution • Plants: Adaptation from Aquatic to Terrestrial Habitat; Important sources of Food and Medicine • Fungi: Recyclers, Killers, and Plant Partners in Nature • Animal: Diversified Body Plan; the Commonality and Complexity of Animal Development • Human and Viruses: How Human Evolved; the Interactions between Hosts and Viruses • Field Trip: Relationship Between Living Organisms and the Environment; Concepts of Sustainability • 導論: 系統發生、演化和物種形成的概念 • 細菌與古細菌: 對醫藥及生物科技的影響 • 原生生物: 全核生物的黎明, 演化中的一個重要里程 • 植物: 從水生到陸上棲息地的適應; 食物和醫藥的重要來源  • 真菌: 自然界中的循環再生者、殺手和植物夥伴 • 動物: 多元化的身體結構; 動物演化中的共通性和複雜性 • 人類與病毒: 人類的演化; 寄主與病毒的相互作用 • 野外考察: 生物與環境的關係; 可持續發展的概念

title: Business and Social Aspects of Biotechnology
description: This course addresses the business and social issues related to the use of modern biotechnology. Topics include business development in the industry, operations in running a bio-business, manufacturing practice, drug development process, regulation and policy, intellectual property issues, environmental aspects of biotechnology, ethical and public concerns.
outcome: 1. Be able to give an intelligent account of what the biotechnology industry is. 2. Understand the interrelationship between science and business development of the biotechnology industry. 3. The impact of science on future directions of biotechnology. 4. Have a firm grasp on various aspects in starting a biotechnology business including fund raising, financing, product development and manufacturing.  5. Understand the legal requirements as applied to the biotechnology industry including contracts, agreements, IPR and patents.  6. Be aware of the social impact of biotechnology. 7. Build up skill and confidence in making decision on biotechnology investment. 通过本课程的学习，学生可以掌握如下技能： 1. 对什么是生物技术相关工业有一个明辨的能力； 2. 理解科学及其商务运作与生物技术工业领域之间的相辅相成关系； 3. 了解科学进步对生物技术未来发展方向的影响； 4. 牢固掌握运作生物技术企业的各方面因素，包括项目资金筹备，财务管理，产品研发和批量生产等； 5. 了解生物技术公司的各类法规规范，比如合同和协议制订，知识产权保护以及专利申请等； 6. 关注生物科技公司对社会的影响； 7. 通过扎实的知识储备树立信心，为生物技术行业的投资决策奠定基础。

title: Medical Biotechnology
description: The field of medical biotechnology is experiencing rapid growth in recent years, leading to the development of innovative techniques for diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of diseases. With the basis in gene manipulation and cell culture, innovations in biomolecular therapies such as recombinant proteins, monoclonal antibodies, vaccines, nucleic acid therapies, and regenerative medicines are developed. These significantly improve human health. The course is designed to give students an insight into the principles and techniques leading to these innovations. Safety and ethical issues will also be discussed. Topics include: 1) History of Medical Biotechnology; 2) High-throughput technologies in molecular diagnosis I and II;3) Clinical sequencing in infectious disease control; 4) Clinical sequencing and precision medicine; 5) Protein therapeutics (pharmaceuticals, recombinant antibodies and enzymes); 6) Nucleic acids therapeutic agents and gene therapy; 7) Current vaccine design; 8) Stem cells and regenerative medicine; 9) Nanoparticles in medicine
outcome: 1. Describe the basic principles and techniques of medical biotechnology. 2. Understand the mechanisms whereby the therapeutic molecules and diagnostic tools work. 3. Evaluate the use of medical biotechnology towards the modern society. 4. Appreciate the range of therapeutic molecules and diagnostic tools developed by the biotechnology industry over the last few years. 5. Realize the potential safety and ethical issues on these technologies on human health.   1. 描述医学生物技术的基本原理和技术。 2. 了解治疗性分子和诊断工具的运作机制。 3. 评估医疗生物技术在现代社会中的应用。 4. 意识到过去几年生物技术行业开发的治疗性分子和诊断工具。 5. 了解这些人类健康技术的潜在安全和道德问题。
syllabus: Topics include: 1) History of Medical Biotechnology; 2) High-throughput technologies in molecular diagnosis I and II; 3) Clinical sequencing in infectious disease control; 4) Clinical sequencing and precision medicine; 5) Protein therapeutics (pharmaceuticals, recombinant antibodies and enzymes); 6) Nucleic acids therapeutic agents and gene therapy; 7) Current vaccine design; 8) Stem cells and regenerative medicine; 9) Nanoparticles in medicine.  題目包括: 1) 醫學生物技術史; 2) 高通量技術分子診斷; 3)傳染病控制的臨床測序; 4) 臨床測序和精準醫學; 5) 蛋白質療法 (藥物、重組抗體和酶); 6) 核酸治療媒介和基因治療; 7) 當前的疫苗設計; 8) 幹細胞和再生醫學; 9) 納米粒子醫學  题目包括: 1) 医学生物技术史; 2) 高通量技术分子诊断; 3)传染病控制的临床测序; 4) 临床测序和精准医学; 5) 蛋白质疗法(药物，重组抗体和酶); 6 ) 核酸治疗媒介和基因治疗; 7) 当前的疫苗设计; 8) 干细胞和再生医学; 9) 纳米粒子医学

title: Methods in Molecular Biotechnology Laboratory I
requirements: Not for students who have taken BCHE3650, CMBI3010 or SBMS2105.
description: This laboratory course will provide hands-on experience to students in widely used techniques in molecular biotechnology, including gene cloning and protein expression analysis.
outcome: Students will learn the basic concepts and techniques of: 1) DNA cloning and analysis; 2) protein expression, western blotting and immunodetection. These provide useful hands-on experience for their future research work. 學生於本實驗科目將會學到以下的基礎概念和技術: 1) 去氧核糖核酸克隆和分折技術；2) 蛋白質表達，蛋白質印跡法和免疫檢測。所學技術對日後的研究工作將會很有幫助。
syllabus: 1) Recombinant DNA and molecular cloning techniques: preparation of insert and vector for cloning; ligation and transformation; mini-preparation of plasmid DNA and OD measurement; screening of positive clone by PCR and restriction digestion; automated DNA sequencing. 2) Gene product analysis: protein extraction; separation of proteins by SDS-PAGE; western blotting and immunodection. 1) 重組去氧核糖核酸及分子克隆技術：制備克隆用的插入片段及載體；接合反應及轉化；質粒的微製備及量度吸光度；用聚合酶鏈反應及酶切來篩選陽性克隆；自動化核酸排序。2) 基因產物分析；蛋白質提取；用聚丙烯醯胺凝膠電泳來分離蛋白；蛋白質印跡法；免疫檢測。

title: Genetic Engineering
description: The course will provide an extended understanding on the basic concepts, applications, and strategies of genetic engineering. Contents include a comprehensive introduction of recombinant DNA technology, selected techniques for genomic and functional genomic studies, and an overview on organism cloning and transgenic organisms.
outcome: Knowledge outcomes: 1. Acquire core knowledge on molecular cloning: the concepts of gene cloning, hybridization and blotting, screening and construction of gene libraries. 2. Acquire updated information on DNA sequencing and application of PCR. 3. Acquire ability to understand different approaches to study gene functions. 4. Acquire understanding of organism cloning and transgenic organisms, including the principles and potential applications. Skills outcomes: 1. Acquire skills in literature survey using various sources including effective usage of information technologies and web-based searches; 2. Acquire good analytical and oral communication skills via class project presentation; 3. Acquire good problem solving skill via course assessment. Values and attitude outcomes: 1. Acquire a positive attitude toward genetic engineering; 2. Acquire an educated mind and responsible attitude to judge the pros and cons of various applications of genetic engineering to the human society and natural environment. 知識成果: 1. 獲得分子複製的核心知識: 基因複製的概念, 分子雜交與印迹, 基因文庫的建構及篩選; 2. 獲得基因測序和聚合酶連鎖反應應用的最新資訊; 3. 獲得明瞭基因組功能研究不同方法的能力; 4. 獲得對生物複製與轉基因生物的原理和應用理解。  技巧成果: 1. 獲得包括有效利用資訊科技及互聯網搜尋等資源來進行文獻研究的技巧; 2. 通過課程專題報告, 獲得良好的分析及口頭報告技巧; 3. 通過課程考核獲得良好的解決問題的能力。  價值與態度成果: 1. 獲得對遺傳工程的正面態度; 2. 獲得基於知識的思維及負責任的態度, 判斷遺傳工程在人類社會及自然環境所引起的正面及反面作用。

title: Plant Biotechnology
description: This course is to prepare students with interests in higher level molecular biology based plant biotechnology. Students enrolled in this course will study the principles of traditional breeding from the molecular biological perspectives; gene discovery by forward and reverse genetics with emphasis on T-DNA and transposons and their application in functional genomics; principles and applications of plant genomics and epigenomics; transgenic technology with detailed discussion on current development of marker-free, gene silencing and RNA interference, and gene stackediting technologies; and application of plant biotechnology with reference to actual examples and relevant industrial perspectives. In addition, food and environmental safety concerns related to genetically-modified crops will be discussed.
outcome: Knowledge outcomes: 1. Acquire ability to comprehend the implication and application of genetic concepts in plant biotechnology; 2. Acquire core knowledge on transgenic technologies related to plant biotechnology, with more detailed knowledge on new techniques such as marker-free, gene silencing and RNA interference, and gene editing; 3. Acquire knowledge on potential applications of plant biotechnology; 4. Acquire an educated understanding on the industrial prospective and safety concerns of plant biotechnology. Skills outcomes: 5. Acquire skills in literature survey using various sources including effective usage of information technologies and web-based searches; 6. Acquire good analytical and oral communication skills via class project presentation; 7. Acquire good problem solving skill via course assessment. Values and attribute outcomes: 8. Acquire a positive attitude toward plant biotechnology; 9. Acquire an educated mind and responsible attitude to judge the pros and cons of various applications of plant biotechnology to the human society and natural environment.  知識成果： 1. 獲得深入理解遺傳學原理在植物生物技術中的內涵及其應用的能力； 2. 獲得植物生物技術相關轉基因技術的核心知識，包括新技術的深入探討，如無標記轉基因技術，基因沉默，RNA幹擾和基因编辑等； 3. 獲得植物生物技術應用前景的知識； 4. 獲得對植物生物技術的工業前景及有關此技術安全問題的深入理解。 技能成果: 5. 獲得利用不同資源搜尋文獻的技能，包括有效的利用資訊技術和網頁搜尋； 6. 過課程專案報告，獲得良好的分析和口頭表達的技能； 7. 通過課程考核，獲得良好的解決問題的技能。 價值觀和屬性成果： 8. 獲得對植物生物技術的積極態度； 9. 獲得以知識的思考和負責任的態度去判斷植物生物技術的各種應用對人類社會和自然環境的利與弊。

title: Microbial Biotechnology
description: Knowledge in microbial technology is growing exponentially throughout the discovery of novel sequences of hundreds of microorganisms and the advancement of new technologies, such as genomics, transcriptomics, proteomics and metabolomics. This course examines the application of the latest technologies in microbial biotechnology to environment, agriculture, industry and medicine. Selected topics include applied microbial physiology; genetic engineering; genomics and proteomics; metabolomics and biosynthetic pathway analysis and industrial fermentation technology. Examples of applications include microbial production of single-cell proteins, protein engineering, primary and secondary metabolites. Plant/animal – microbe interactions and microbial technology in biocatalysis, biodegradation and bioremediation will also be discussed. Two project orientated laboratory sections will also be included. Students will gain hands-on experience on conducting latest microbial biotechnology researches.
outcome: 1. Critical thinking in solving microbial biotechnology related problems  2. Learn and aware of the latest technology of microbial technology in the industry  3. Understand the trends and application of microbial biotechnology related products  4. Able to perform independent research and evaluation on assigned fermentation projects  5. Understand the logistics of downstream processing of biotechnology product 通过本课程的学习，同学们将掌握以下技能： 1. 运用辩证思维思考微生物学技术在其相关领域的应用问题。 2. 学习并关注工业领域最近使用的相关微生物技术的应用情况。 3. 理解微生物技术应用领域相关产品的发展趋势和前景。 4. 具备独立研究的技能，并能合理评判特定发酵工程的状况。 5. 理解生物技术产物的下游处理流程。
